item.title: Ticket #1212 (permalinks don't work with wp in a subdirectory) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description:
WP lookd for .htaccess in the directory that corresponds to the "Blog Address" settings in Options->General.

Permalinks should work just fine in a subdirectory.

item.title: Ticket #1212 (permalinks don't work with wp in a subdirectory) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1212 (permalinks don't work with wp in a subdirectory) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
i couldn't seem to get my permalinks to work after i moved my wp files around, even though i totally removed the htaccess, tried to do it all manually, etc. wp said it couldn't find my htaccess, and i gave up.

as soon as i moved my wp files to the root directory, however, everything cleared up - wp said my permalinks were updated, etc. seems like there is a bug with permalinks and subdirectories?

item.description: Patch changed

item.description: If you write a post with a title containing entities for ccented characters, the feed doenst validate on ​http://feedvalidator.org/ and readers like RSSOwl doesn't validate the feed too.

item.title: Ticket #1204 (Blog stats do not display correctly in the Dashboard) updated
item.dc:creator: drdave
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1204 (Blog stats do not display correctly in the Dashboard) created
item.dc:creator: drdave
item.description:
The formatting string to display number of comments/posts/categories is wrong:

printf(('There are currently %1$d <a href="%2$s" title="Posts">posts</a> and %3$d <a href="%4$s" title="Comments">comments</a>, contained within %5$d <a href="%6$s" title="categories">categories</a>.'), $numposts, 'edit.php', $numcomms, 'edit-comments.php', $numcats, 'categories.php');

should be:

printf(('There are currently %1$s <a href="%2$s" title="Posts">posts</a> and %3$s <a href="%4$s" title="Comments">comments</a>, contained within %5$s <a href="%6$s" title="categories">categories</a>.'), $numposts, 'edit.php', $numcomms, 'edit-comments.php', $numcats, 'categories.php');

The difference being that the counts are formatted as strings rather than digits.

Otherwise, any number above 1000 ends up shortened because of number_format() returning 1,000 etc.

item.title: Ticket #1203 (option panel bug) updated
item.dc:creator: Denis de Bernardy
item.description: As an aside: The html/head/title displays 'contact' rather than something relevant as a default for panels that are added by plugins. You might want to remove this altogether.

item.title: Ticket #1203 (option panel bug) updated
item.dc:creator: Denis de Bernardy
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1203 (option panel bug) created
item.dc:creator: Denis de Bernardy
item.description:
An amusing bug:

  • Create an instance of WordPress 1.5 strayhorn
  • Add and activate the BAStats plugin
  • Go to the Stats options

It will display the stats options

  • Add and activate the subscribe to comments plugin
  • Go to the Stats options

It will display the subscribe to comments options

item.title: Ticket #1202 (Level 0 users see Register/Login instead of Admin/Logout) updated
item.dc:creator: sehh
item.description:
Uploaded patch for bug 1202.

This is based on the latest wp-includes/template-functions-general.php

Just put it in the wp-includes/ directory and apply with: patch <bug1202.patch

It would also be nice if "Site Admin" was changed to something like "Profile" for low level users, since site administration isn't exactly what a low level user would be able to do in there. Thought that would require a few other changes as well, so we'll leave it for another time.

item.title: Ticket #1202 (Level 0 users see Register/Login instead of Admin/Logout) updated
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1202 (Level 0 users see Register/Login instead of Admin/Logout) updated
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1202 (Level 0 users see Register/Login instead of Admin/Logout) created
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description:
wp_loginout() and wp_register() use this to determine "logged in" status:

if (0 == $user_level) :

Thus, level 0 users aren't seen as being logged in.
